items.body:
## Description

### What steps will reproduce the problem?

<!--- You can use Markdown here --->

- set console directory to network folder -> then issue reporter appeared and directory is not changed

### Traceback

Hello, I am using Python 3.7 via Spyder 3.3.6 (as part of the Anaconda suite) as part of a class I'm currently taking. (I'm new to Python, so I apologize in advance if the answer to resolving this error seems obvious.)
How do I move past this error?


### What steps reproduce the problem?

import pandas
import numpy
import seaborn
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
data = pandas.read_csv('classdata_pds.csv', low_memory=False)

sub2['PACKSPERMONTH']=sub2['NUMCIGMO_EST'] / 20
c12 = sub2.groupby('PACKSPERMONTH').size()

sub2['PACKCATEGORY']=pandas.cut(sub2.PACKSPERMONTH, 0, 5, 10, 20, 30, 147)

### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

Instead receiving:  ValueError: `bins` should be a positive integer 



Thank you!
```

When I open spyder, I receive the following error:
You have missing dependencies! 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52978328/90654781-c0c86700-e20e-11ea-9408-aa922dc066ff.png)

items.body:
<!--- **PLEASE READ:** When submitting here, please ensure you've completed the following checklist and checked the boxes to confirm. Issue reports without it may be closed. Thanks! --->

### Issue Report Checklist

* [x] Completed the **Problem Description**, **Steps to Reproduce** and **Version** sections below

Hello - I've seen some similar issues like, but nothing that exactly fits what I'm experiencing.

## Problem Description
spyder crashes when computer goes to sleep. Error message is `segmentation fault: 11`


### What steps reproduce the problem?
1. Launch spyder from terminal
`spyder3`
2. Everything is fine all day as I'm using it. 
3. Close laptop, computer goes to sleep.
4. Come back the next day, spyder has crashed, with the message `Segmentation fault: 11` in the terminal.
5. This happens every day

### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
I expect it not to happen


### Paste Traceback/Error Below (if applicable)

<!--- **PLEASE READ:** When submitting here, please ensure you've completed the following checklist and checked the boxes to confirm. Issue reports without it may be closed. Thanks! --->

### Issue Report Checklist

* [ done] Searched the [issues page](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for similar reports
* [done ] Read the relevant sections of the [Spyder Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/wiki/Troubleshooting-Guide-and-FAQ) and followed its advice
* [ done] Reproduced the issue after updating with ``conda update spyder`` (or ``pip``, if not using Anaconda)
* [ ] Could not reproduce inside ``jupyter qtconsole`` (if console-related)
* [done ] Tried basic troubleshooting (if a bug/error)
    * [ done] Restarted Spyder
    * [ done] Reset preferences with ``spyder --reset``
    * [ done] Reinstalled the latest version of [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/download/)
    * [ done] Tried the other applicable steps from the Troubleshooting Guide
* [ done] Completed the **Problem Description**, **Steps to Reproduce** and **Version** sections below


## Problem Description
After power outage, Spyder will not boot via anaconda console, shortcut, or navigator.
I have tried steps offered on other tickets. I have also uninstalled Anaconda, removed all leftover folders having to do with anaconda/spyder/python, removed registry entries, restarted machine, installed Anaconda (latest version), rebooted machine again. Spyder will still not launch. A clean install on a different machine does work.


### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Expect Spyder to launch. It does not launch, offers no error messages in anaconda terminal. There is no hanging process.

items.title: Spyder requesting PySide but unable to install the module.
items.body:
Hey, recently Spyder stopped working and I tested this issue in two different Manjaro installations. From what I understand, Spyder requests a module named PySide, but this one isn't available with the most recent Python version (atm is 3.8), so it won't install at all.

So I tried to install PySide2, and it did install, but Spyder is still requesting PySide, so it won't start.

I don't understand how there's no one else with this same issue tho.

This is the console output when I try to run Spyder:
`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qtpy/__init__.py", line 204, in <module>
    from PySide import __version__ as PYSIDE_VERSION  # analysis:ignore
**ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'PySide'**

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/spyder", line 3, in <module>
    start.main()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/spyder/app/start.py", line 200, in main
    from spyder.app import mainwindow
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/spyder/app/mainwindow.py", line 53, in <module>
    requirements.check_qt()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/spyder/requirements.py", line 41, in check_qt
    import qtpy
  File "/home/~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qtpy/__init__.py", line 210, in <module>
    raise PythonQtError('No Qt bindings could be found')
qtpy.PythonQtError: No Qt bindings could be found
`

And this is the output when I run "pip install PySide"

`    ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1:
     command: /usr/bin/python -c 'import sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'/tmp/pip-install-mbomvpq0/pyside/setup.py'"'"'; __file__='"'"'/tmp/pip-install-mbomvpq0/pyside/setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' egg_info --egg-base /tmp/pip-pip-egg-info-i518bqx5

    Complete output (1 lines):
    **only these python versions are supported: [(2, 6), (2, 7), (3, 2), (3, 3), (3, 4)]**
    ----------------------------------------
ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: python setup.py egg_info Check the logs for full command output.
`

<!--- **PLEASE READ:** When submitting here, please ensure you've completed the following checklist and checked the boxes to confirm. Issue reports without it may be closed. Thanks! --->

### Issue Report Checklist

* [x] Searched the [issues page](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for similar reports
* [x] Read the relevant sections of the [Spyder Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/wiki/Troubleshooting-Guide-and-FAQ) and followed its advice
* [x] Reproduced the issue after updating with ``conda update spyder`` (or ``pip``, if not using Anaconda)
* [ ] Could not reproduce inside ``jupyter qtconsole`` (if console-related)
* [x] Tried basic troubleshooting (if a bug/error)
    * [x] Restarted Spyder
    * [ ] Reset preferences with ``spyder --reset``
    * [x] Reinstalled the latest version of [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/download/)
    * [x] Tried the other applicable steps from the Troubleshooting Guide
* [x] Completed the **Problem Description**, **Steps to Reproduce** and **Version** sections below


## Problem Description
I re-installed Anaconda again yesterday as it had stopped working properly. It worked fine after the re-install yesterday though matplotlib.pyplot had some issues while plotting: it was slow. Today I started having serious issues.

Issue: After an exception, the IPython console stops processing any command and instead gives ERROR: execution aborted. 

Attempted Solutions:

Close current console and open new console. The new console suffers from the same issue that it gives ERROR: execution aborted after any exception

Updating Anaconda and Spyder: Everything updated as new installation

Re-installing Anaconda: Re-installed anaconda again to day. Unfortunately did not fix the problem.

A similar issue was reported [here](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues/13453). Unfortunately, no fix was provided and the issue closed.


### What steps reproduce the problem?

1. Any exception is raised.
2. 
3. 

### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
The expected out put for 1 would be 1. Instead I see  ERROR: execution aborted

items.title: "Run in current namespace" missing in Spyder 5.0.0a1
items.body:
The Spyder Run options are missing from the latest version of the software.
In particular, it is not possible to set the option for running scripts in "console's current namespace instead of an empty one", as described here: https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/pull/10032

Is there a workaround for setting "current_namespace=True" to all runfile calls?
I need to define variables on-the-fly and use them while running script files.

Thank you for your help.

items.title: Plotting won't work after introducing Fix #525
items.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

I experienced the same problem as reported in issue #13275 after installing Spyder 4.1.4. The fix proposed in #525 got rid of the flush of warning in the console, but plotting became very slow (interactive zooming etc. takes forever) and the plot windows mostly stay in the background. I tried differnt things, like changing the backend and reinstalling Anaconda but finally found that commenting out the lines of code that were proposed in fix #525 was the only thing that fixed the plotting issue. But then I get the warnings back. 
This can be reproduced by plotting anything, like e.g. x = [1,2,3,4,5], plt.plot(x) (matplotlib.pyplot)
What can I do? Thanks!

### Issue Report Checklist

* [x] Searched the [issues page](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for similar reports

items.title: Tkinter window different format while executing .py file and with spyder
items.body:
My Tkinter window is appearing different while I am executing the .py file compared to how it is appearing while executing with spyder. I want my window to look like spyder execution on normal .py file execution. I am not sure what is causing this, i suspect it is something related spyder encoding or something

spyder version: 4.1.3
Python version: 3.7.6 (anaconda installation)

The below image is the execution of .py file
![without spyder](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62382910/89760572-4b6fde80-db0a-11ea-9e5f-e94d047fb0df.jpg)
the below image is execution with spyder
![with spyder](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62382910/89760575-4d39a200-db0a-11ea-9c33-6ca121b89ebe.jpg)

items.title: Feature ;Recommendation for spyder 5.0
items.body:
Am using over the last 3 years, this is a great IDE, why ?
(am on windows)

   Variable Explorer is perfect for quick coding/data wrangling.
   Embedded Ipython for quick prototyping / debugging.
   Auto-completion is good, not perfect, but doing the job of accelerating typing.
   Can open Jupyter notebook (!!!)
   "Relatively" stable.

Now, am using Spyder 3.0 instead of Spyder 4.0 , why ?  

     New features was brought Auto-completion, in the end this became very instable, barely usable.
     The only spyder version I found usable is 4.0 beta 5 
     A lot of code/feature breaking ; Variable Explorer. Pane freezing,....
     Finally, I came back to Spyder 3.0 , Why   :  
     It just works, without heavy memory   :  
        Variable Explorer, Auto-completion, Open Jupyter notebook, Almost never crash....

My advice for Spyder 5,0 :  
    Double the amount of code testing,  
    Add testing using "IDE Robot Click"  to simulate basic user scenarios....
    Just having basic things work well, is the key for productivity (vs a ton of features, not usable).

Thanks

items.title: Debug switch function, function in the window before the data is gone.
items.body:
<!--- **PLEASE READ:** When submitting here, please ensure you've completed the following checklist and checked the boxes to confirm. Issue reports without it may be closed. Thanks! --->

## Problem Description

I am debugging a called function. When I use Ctrl+F11 to jump to the inside of this function to debug, I find that the window in the upper right corner of the spyder loses the variables before entering the function. Is there a way to retrieve these variables?


For example, in the following example, I set a breakpoint on the line y_pred = rnn.forward(X[i]). When I enter the forward function to debug, the variables X, Y, rnn, learning_rate, etc., saved in the window They are temporarily hidden. After entering forward, the window only displays the variables such as self and x of forward itself. I want to see the original X, Y, rnn, learning_rate at the same time as the debug forward function. Can it be achieved?
------------------------------------
    X, y_int2, y_int10 = gen_data(20, 2, 5) # X.shape---(samples, input_size1, input_size2)
    X = np.array(X)        # A sample of data is [X[0], Y[0]]
    Y = np.array(y_int10)  # Y.shape=(20, 1)---(samples, input_size)
    # 初始
    rnn = RNN(5, 2)  # input_size, hidden_size
    learning_rate = 1e-3
    for epoch in range(3000):
        for i in range(len(X)):
            y_pred = rnn.forward(X[i])
------------------------------------
    def forward(self, x):
        self.h_state = []
        self.x = x
        h = np.zeros(self.hidden_size)
        for i in x:
            self.h_state.append(h)
            h = self.rnncell.forward(i, h) # h每次被更新后保存到h_state
        self.h_out = h
        return self.h_out
------------------------------------
### What steps reproduce the problem?

1. 
2. 
3. 


## Versions

items.title: Unable to Sort by Numeric Value
items.body:
Problem Description
I am unable to sort by Numeric Value.


### What steps reproduce the problem?
import pandas 
data = pandas.read_csv('nesarc_pds.csv', low_memory=False)
data["S2AQ8A"] = data["S2AQ8A"].apply(pandas.to_numeric,errors="coerce")
data["S2AQ8B"] = data["S2AQ8B"].apply(pandas.to_numeric,errors="coerce")

print("counts for S2AQ8A - How often drank in last 12 months")
c4 = data["S2AQ8A"].value_counts(sort=False, dropna=False)
print (c4)

print("percentages for S2AQ8A How often drank in last 12 months")
p4 = data["S2AQ8A"].value_counts(sort=False, normalize=True)
print (p4)

print("counts for S2AQ8B - How many drinks consumed on days when drank")
c5 = data["S2AQ8B"].value_counts(sort=False, dropna=False)
print (c5)

print("percentages for S2AQ8B How many drinks consumed on days when drank")
p5 = data["S2AQ8B"].value_counts(sort=False, normalize=True)   
print (p5)

### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
The output I get is:

items.title: Size of autosave window

## Description

### What steps will reproduce the problem?

<!--- You can use Markdown here --->

items.title: Manjaro Spyder Bugs
items.body:
OS: Manjaro 20.0.3 Lysia
Kernel: x86_64 Linux 5.7.9-1-MANJARO

* Spyder version: 4.1.3 on Manjaro / 4.1.4 on Anaconda
* Python version: 3.8.3
* Qt version: 5.9.7
* PyQt version: 5.9.2

0. I am a manjaro user. I have downloaded spyder from pacman (I don't use spyder from anaconda because it cannot open .py files simply by double clicking the file). It is very slow and sometimes stop when clicking "OK" on settings and returns this:
![Screenshot_20200806_171845](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65082432/89514806-eb76f080-d808-11ea-9444-bcb14024574d.png)

1. I found that my spyder on anaconda for linux cannot use all the mono fonts on my computer, and I cannot input letters besides English, like Greek letters or Chinese characters.

2. On the other hand, with anaconda for windows, where its spyder can type Chinese, I found that the line height will become higher when that line has Chinese characters in the same font size, unlike VScode or PyCharm where the line heights are fixed. (It seems that in 4.1.3 for Manjaro it is OK, maybe it is Windows' fault?)

3. My language is set to Chinese, copy and paste texts in Chinese into Spyder is OK.If you try to input the letter, does nothing happen, or is a different letter produced instead? It will review the English letter because in fact I cannot change my input method into Chinese, so what I print is what I see.

4. Spyder has no permission for ipython-kernel
I have downloaded spyder from pacman (I don't use spyder from anaconda because it cannot open .py files simply by double clicking the file). But when I set the interpreter as anaconda python and installed ipython-kernel, it says that:

An error ocurred while starting the kernel
The error is:

![Screenshot_20200806_171745](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65082432/89514707-c4202380-d808-11ea-9b15-0a82abf350fc.png)

Like it can only use the default interpreter, installed when installing Manjaro. conda update anaconda & conda install jupyter_client=5.3.4 don't work.

I hope that Spyder can do better in supporting numerous languages. Maybe we can choose several fonts like VScode, with priority levels, and remain the line height fixed. And also for the Manjaro version, give the permission to use all python interpreters on the computer instead of the default python on /root. Thank you！

items.title: Can't open Dict in variable explorer with mixed data types as keys.
items.body:
## Description

### What steps will reproduce the problem?

<!--- You can use Markdown here --->

1: Create a dictionary with a mixture of strings and numeric values as keys.
eg.
colors = {1: 'red','Y': 'yellow'}

2: Attempt to open the dictionary in the variable explorer.

3: no profit.

EDIT:
Using this function:
```
def mixs(self, num):
    try:
        ele = int(num)
        return (0, ele, '')
    except ValueError:
        return (1, num, '')
```
 as a key for the sorted() here:
```
File "C:\Users\ifeed\anaconda3\envs\spyder\lib\site-packages\spyder\plugins\variableexplorer\widgets\collectionseditor.py", line 173, in set_data
    self.keys = sorted(list(data.keys()))

items.title: Recursing problem with new plugin API on master
items.body:
<!--- **PLEASE READ:** When submitting here, please ensure you've completed the following checklist and checked the boxes to confirm. Issue reports without it may be closed. Thanks! --->

### Issue Report Checklist

* [ ] Searched the [issues page](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for similar reports
* [ ] Read the relevant sections of the [Spyder Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/wiki/Troubleshooting-Guide-and-FAQ) and followed its advice
* [ ] Reproduced the issue after updating with ``conda update spyder`` (or ``pip``, if not using Anaconda)
* [ ] Could not reproduce inside ``jupyter qtconsole`` (if console-related)
* [ ] Tried basic troubleshooting (if a bug/error)
    * [ ] Restarted Spyder
    * [ ] Reset preferences with ``spyder --reset``
    * [ ] Reinstalled the latest version of [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/download/)
    * [ ] Tried the other applicable steps from the Troubleshooting Guide
* [X] Completed the **Problem Description**, **Steps to Reproduce** and **Version** sections below

## Problem Description
@goanpeca

open_project function project plugin doesn't behave as expected, as [spyder/plugins/projects/plugin.py#L373](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/blob/f04e1d45d31988e6518fc49404f3fc5801eaa10c/spyder/plugins/projects/plugin.py#L373) is called recursively ...

## Solution/Work-around

initialization of project instance should not take "self" as argument, this has the consequence that the
project will call itself (it's open_project function) each time the Semi-ATE Plugin called it's open_project 
function, and then we stuck in a circle relationship in which Semi-ATE Plugin called open_project function
of the project plugin and vise versa !!!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3516972/89291548-07d52a80-d65b-11ea-9a48-12552e2bc3a8.png)

```python
        if project is None:
            project_type = self._load_project_type(path)
            project_types = self.get_project_types()
            if project_type in project_types:
                # project = project_types[project_type](path, self)  !!
                project_type_class = project_types[project_type]
                project = project_type_class(path, project_type_class._PARENT_PLUGIN
            else:
                project = EmptyProject(path, self)
```

### What steps reproduce the problem?

1. Open an existing Semi-ATE project or Create a Semi-ATE project then restart spyder
 
### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

N/A

### Paste Traceback/Error Below (if applicable)
<!--- Copy from error dialog or View > Panes > Internal Console --->

```python-traceback

N/A

```

## Versions
<!--- You can get this information from Help > About Spyder...
or (if Spyder won't launch) the "conda list" command
from the Anaconda Prompt/Terminal/command line. --->

* Spyder version: master branch
* Python version: 3.7
* Qt version: N/A
* PyQt version:  N/A
* Operating System name/version: observed on Linux&Windows 

### Dependencies
<!--- Please go to the menu entry Help > Dependencies,
press the Copy to clipboard button and paste below --->

```
N/A
```

items.title: Plotnine plots not showing up
items.body:
I am running the example code from the plotnine website using a script. The plot shows up with the exact same code in Jupyter, but not in Spyder (neither inline, nor in the Plots window)

```
from plotnine import ggplot, geom_point, aes, stat_smooth, facet_wrap
from plotnine.data import mtcars

(ggplot(mtcars, aes('wt', 'mpg', color='factor(gear)'))
 + geom_point()
 + stat_smooth(method='lm')
 + facet_wrap('~gear'))

```

Found a workaround but hoping for a more practical solution. I slightly modify the ggplot code in the script to
`ss=(ggplot(mtcars, aes('wt', 'mpg', color='factor(gear)')))
`
and then type the following into the console:
`(ss+ geom_point() + stat_smooth(method='lm') + facet_wrap('~gear'))
`

items.title: Spyder crashes when "replace in selection"
items.body:
<!--- **PLEASE READ:** When submitting here, please ensure you've completed the following checklist and checked the boxes to confirm. Issue reports without it may be closed. Thanks! --->

### Issue Report Checklist

* [ ] Searched the [issues page](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for similar reports
* [ ] Read the relevant sections of the [Spyder Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/wiki/Troubleshooting-Guide-and-FAQ) and followed its advice
* [ ] Reproduced the issue after updating with ``conda update spyder`` (or ``pip``, if not using Anaconda)
* [ ] Could not reproduce inside ``jupyter qtconsole`` (if console-related)
* [ ] Tried basic troubleshooting (if a bug/error)
    * [ ] Restarted Spyder
    * [ ] Reset preferences with ``spyder --reset``
    * [ ] Reinstalled the latest version of [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/download/)
    * [ ] Tried the other applicable steps from the Troubleshooting Guide
* [ ] Completed the **Problem Description**, **Steps to Reproduce** and **Version** sections below


## Problem Description

Spyder crashes when I try to replace in selection, specifically when I try to replace multiple lines of code simultaneously. I had not had this problem before, I uninstalled and reinstalled anaconda and it keeps happening

### What steps reproduce the problem?

1. Slecting multiple lines of code
2. command to find and replace
3. replace in selection

### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

My expected output is tu replace the specific value for the assigned one but insted of that, the program turns off.

items.title: Completion and linting in the editor for Python files will not work during current session, or stopped working.
items.body: ### Issue Report Checklist * [x] Searched the [issues page](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for similar reports * [x] Read the relevant sections of the [Spyder Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/wiki/Troubleshooting-Guide-and-FAQ) and followed its advice * [x] Reproduced the issue after updating with ``conda update spyder`` (or ``pip``, if not using Anaconda) * [ ] Could not reproduce inside ``jupyter qtconsole`` (if console-related) * [x] Tried basic troubleshooting (if a bug/error) * [x] Restarted Spyder * [x] Reset preferences with ``spyder --reset`` * [x] Reinstalled the latest version of [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/download/) * [x] Tried the other applicable steps from the Troubleshooting Guide * [x] Completed the **Problem Description**, **Steps to Reproduce** and **Version** sections below ## Problem Description After a few seconds of opening Spyder, I get the message in the title of the issue. LSP Python is down. Linting and completion work for a few seconds when opening Spyder, then stopped and the pop up shows again. Same problem as the one describe on #11026. As requested there, I'm opening a new issue. ### Steps taken that didn't help the issue - Running `conda update -all` - Reinstalled Anaconda. - Running `spyder --reset` - Unable to reproduce issue on Windows. ### What steps reproduce the problem? 1. Open Spyder. 2. Wait a few seconds. 3. The pop-up shows again. ## Versions * Spyder version: 4.1.4 * Python version: 3.7.7 * Operating System name/version: macOS 10.15.6 ## Screenshots

items.body:
<!--- **PLEASE READ:** When submitting here, please ensure you've completed the following checklist and checked the boxes to confirm. Issue reports without it may be closed. Thanks! --->

### Issue Report Checklist

* [x] Searched the [issues page](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for similar reports
* [x] Read the relevant sections of the [Spyder Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/wiki/Troubleshooting-Guide-and-FAQ) and followed its advice

* [x] Tried basic troubleshooting (if a bug/error)
    * [x] Restarted Spyder

## Problem Description
I have recently re-installed Anaconda and Spyder from scratch, since `conda update conda` did not work. After it, Spyder started to give me problems. Every now and then, probably 6 out 10 times a run a line/code the Console shots a `ERROR: execution aborted`, and I have to re-start the code from scratch.


### What steps reproduce the problem?

1. Running a single line or a full script.
2. At any moment, in the beginning, running code chunks, or close to finish.
3. I have to start from scratch every time.

A smooth and clean run from beginning to end of my script.

items.title: Installed Kite through spyder and it doesn't work
items.body:
## Problem Description
I installed Kite through spyder and whenever I launch spyder; 
Case 1: Sometimes spyder's launcher shows and stays stuck on "Loading code completion client for python" and I need to click on the launcher, later it will say the python isn't answering and it'll ask me if I want to try to restore Python, and if I select that option, spyder will load but Kite won't and at the bottom right of spyder it'll show "Kite: ".
Case 2: Other times spyder loads well but kite's copilot doesn't launch and at the bottom right of spyder it shows "Kite: ".
Case 3: And other times the kite copilot does launch but it stays stuck on "Initializing", and at the bottom right of spyder it shows "Kite: Indexing". 
I also tried downloading kite through the web page but the same errors occur.  Also please note I haven't tried with other IDEs and I don't think they would change that Kite never goes past "initializing" even if I launch it alone. I also tried downgrading spyder to 4.0.1 for that the LSP can't work because I read an issue that was similar to mine where downgrading spyder worked, but it didn't work for me. And I have also set an issue through the Kite issues repository but 5 days have passed and they haven't answered.


### What steps reproduce the problem?

Most of the time when I launch spyder after turning on the pc, case 1 will occur, but after closing spyder and opening it again, or case 3 or case 2 will occur, but case 3 happens most of the time when launching spyder again. But recently now when I launch spyder after turning on the pc, case 2 is starting to happen more often. Also in very little cases I need to do case 1 after closing and relaunching spyder.


## Versions

* Spyder version: 4.1.4
* Python version: 3.7.6
* Qt version: 5.9.6
* PyQt version: 5.9.2
* Operating System name/version: Windows 10 Home


### Dependencies

```

atomicwrites >=1.2.0           :  1.4.0 (OK)

cloudpickle >=0.5.0            :  1.5.0 (OK)

items.title: Explorer "New" actions should depend on selected files
items.body:
### Problem Description

The explorer context menu actions in "New" use the root path of the current directory. Prior to #13032 the directory was depending on the selected file or folder, which IMHO is more convenient. 
As an argument why the new behavior is inconvenient, when just entering a file name and clicking save the file would be created outside the current project.

### What steps reproduce the problem?

1. Open a project
2. Right click on a file in the project
3. New -> New file...

### What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
The save-file-dialog opens at the root folder, in which the project is located. Instead, i would expect the dialog to open at the directory containing the right clicked file.

## Versions
<!--- You can get this information from Help > About Spyder...
or (if Spyder won't launch) the "conda list" command
from the Anaconda Prompt/Terminal/command line. --->

* Python version: 3.7.7 64-bit
* Qt version: 5.9.6
* PyQt version: 5.9.2
* Operating System name/version: Linux 5.7.10-arch1-1

items.title: Freezing for a few min on starting spyder 1.4.1
items.body:
I am using the latest spyder on Ubuntu 16.04. I notice that when I open the spyder it freezes for a few minutes and then works fine.
It is annoying at the beginning when it freezes.
Any suggestions why this happens.

Spyder 4.1.4 
Python 3.6.6 64-bit | Qt 5.9.6 | PyQt5 5.9.2 | Linux 4.15.0-112-generic 
Using anaconda to install spyder
